job title: Data Quality Incident Analyst - Associate Vice President
job description:

Job Summary:
The Data Quality Incident Analyst is based within the Compliance Data Office of the Americas Financial Crimes Compliance (AFCC) Division and reports directly to the Compliance Data Officer for the Americas. This new position is required to support Data Management and related initiatives within the Americas, with a specific focus on supporting the Data Quality Incident management process.

Major Responsibilities:
  • Support the Data Quality (DQ) Incident Lead in the management of a data incident as it relates to Transaction Filtering, Transaction Monitoring, and KYC business processes and associated systems
  • Support projects from a data management perspective to support execution of AFCC's data initiatives or regulatory mandates
  • Work closely with the compliance LOBs, CDO, ISA and our data producers to understand and facilitate triage/resolution/prioritization of DQ issues
  • Develop tactical solutions to DQ issues as appropriate
  • Keep management updated on DQ issues, highlighting DQ themes, and provide input into periodic KPI/KRI reporting
Additional Information:
  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Minimum of 2 years of data analysis experience with good knowledge of financial services
  • Ability to research information and analyze data to arrive at valid conclusions, recommendations, and courses of action
  • Experience with root cause analysis and the ability to ask probing questions in the process to piece together from end to end
  • Proven experience in a consultancy or solutions analysis environment with specialization in business analysis
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with proven ability to handle multiple projects at one time
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills
Preferred Skills:
  • Proven strategic thinker and decision maker
  • Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills
  • Extensive knowledge of emerging industry practices in problem solving scenarios
  • Change management skills
  • An excellent level of analysis experience and knowledge of structured techniques and industry standards
